intro: Sida obliqua, commonly known as the waxy leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. Sida obliqua is often found in dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh, coastal conditions.
